home.first-text: For four months, the Photo-Voice competition, part of the MOVE & ACT project, will run as a platform for young people to showcase their talent and raise their voices about issues in their community. MOVE & ACT encourages young people to express their creativity and concerns through digital photography. The main objective of the project is to empower participants, improve their employability, help them build a European identity and foster their engagement with local, national and European communities.

works.fourth-header: Voting hasn't started yet. You can view all the contest phases in the "About" section.
works.first-text: There are 25 works from 5 countries: Poland, Greece, Italy, Spain, Lithuania.
works.second-text: You can vote for 5 works, each from a different country.
works.third-text: To choose works from specific select one of the 5 flags. The highlighted flag will indicate the origin of the displayed works.
works.fourth-text: After selecting the flag you will see 5 works from the selected country.
works.fifth-text: To vote for a specific work click "Vote" button.
works.sixth-text: To see more details about the work click the "Details" button.

guidelines.fourth-subheader: Move & Act - Empower Youth through Entrepreneurial and Digital Skills.
guidelines.first-accordion-header: What is the The Move&Act Photo-Voice Contest?
guidelines.first-accordion-third-text: is part of the Erasmus+ project
guidelines.first-accordion-fourth-text: Move & Act- Empower Youth through Entrepreneurial and Digital Skills
guidelines.first-accordion-fifth-text: This initiative aims to develop digital, creative and entrepreneurial skills among young people. The contest provides a
guidelines.first-accordion-sixth-text: platform for participants to express their challenges and experiences through photography
guidelines.first-accordion-seventh-text: , thereby improving their employability, fostering a European identity and
guidelines.first-accordion-nineth-text: with the local, national and European community.
guidelines.second-accordion-first-text: Photo-Voice is a qualitative research method that combines
guidelines.second-accordion-fifth-text: to document and address social issues. This method was developed in the 1990s by Caroline Wang and Mary Ann Burris and enables communities to
guidelines.second-accordion-tenth-text: that reflect their experiences, challenges or perspectives on specific topics such as poverty, unemployment, education, environmental issues and more. These photos will be accompanied by narratives that
guidelines.second-accordion-eleventh-text: contextualise the images and provide deeper insight

guidelines.nineteenth-accordion-first-text: All entries will undergo an initial screening to ensure that they fulfill the basic entry and submission criteria.
guidelines.nineteenth-accordion-third-text: It will be checked whether the participant is between 18 and 30 years old and is a national/resident in one of the participating countries (Poland, Italy, Spain, Greece, Lithuania).
guidelines.nineteenth-accordion-twelveth-text: The uploaded files are in the
guidelines.nineteenth-accordion-nineteenth-text: Only entries that pass this first check will make it to the next round.
guidelines.20-accordion-first-text: Entries will be evaluated by a jury of seven professionals based on the following criteria:
guidelines.20-accordion-third-text: (30 points): The striking and memorable overall effect of the image.
guidelines.20-accordion-fifth-text: (30 points): Originality of composition, lighting and subject matter.
guidelines.20-accordion-seventh-text: (30 points): The ability of the photograph and written description to convey a story or message.
guidelines.20-accordion-nineth-text: (10 points): Evaluation of technical aspects such as image composition, focus and use of light or editing.
guidelines.21-accordion-first-text: To ensure a smooth participation process, it's important to know the important dates and phases of the Move&Act Photo-Voice Contest. Below are the most important dates that participants need to be aware of.
guidelines.21-accordion-sixth-text: Participants prepare their entries, access the contest guidelines and resources, and receive personalised support if needed.
guidelines.21-accordion-nineth-text: The jury reviews all entries and selects the finalists.
guidelines.21-accordion-twelveth-text: The finalists are announced on the project's Social Media channels and their works are uploaded to the contest website.
guidelines.21-accordion-fifteenth-text: The works of the selected finalists are presented on the contest platform so that the public can view and vote for their favourite works.
guidelines.21-accordion-eighteenth-text: Participants are encouraged to engage, share the news and motivate people to vote.
guidelines.21-accordion-21-text: The 5 national winners are announced on the contest platform and Social Media channels. Each winner is also notified by email.
guidelines.21-accordion-24-text: The project partners organise an event in each country and present the winners' printed works (lithophane format). The winners (are welcome to) attend the event(s) and share their experiences.

guidelines.23-accordion-first-text: A lithophane is a unique work of art that transforms a flat, two-dimensional image into a
guidelines.23-accordion-third-text: By changing the thickness of a translucent material, lithophanes really come into their own when backlit, revealing a detailed and impressive image when light falls on them. This art form, which
guidelines.23-accordion-fifth-text: combines intricate craftsmanship with the science of light and shadow, turning each piece into a captivating visual story.
guidelines.23-accordion-eighth-text: lithophanes are a powerful medium for young participants to express their creativity. This contest offers young people the opportunity to practice and improve their digital skills while developing artistic abilities.
guidelines.24-accordion-first-text: Step-by-step instructions to help them with technical aspects, along with storytelling techniques and other useful information.

guidelines.28-accordion-first-text: Entries must be submitted via the official contest channel.
guidelines.28-accordion-second-text: Entries submitted via other channels will be disqualified.
guidelines.29-accordion-first-text: The photos must be original and taken by the participant.
guidelines.29-accordion-second-text: Third party material is not permitted.
guidelines.29-accordion-third-text: The photos must not infringe any intellectual property rights or data protection rights.
guidelines.30-accordion-fourth-text: Excessive alterations will result in disqualification and exclusion from future contests.
guidelines.31-accordion-third-text: of the total image. In order to maintain transparency, it must be clearly disclosed (e.g. “This is an AI-generated image”).
guidelines.32-accordion-first-text: A jury of seven professionals will judge the entries.
guidelines.32-accordion-third-text: Move&Act reserves the right to disqualify entries that are inappropriate or violate the rules.
guidelines.33-accordion-third-text: or invasive of privacy will be removed and not considered for the contest.
guidelines.33-accordion-eighth-text: is required. If a submitted photo shows a recognisable minor, a declaration of consent.
guidelines.33-accordion-tenth-text: to ensure that the rights of the minor(s)/young person(s) are protected.
guidelines.34-accordion-first-text: The submitted works remain the property of the Move&Act project.
guidelines.34-accordion-second-text: By entering, participants agree that their photos/files can be used by Move&Act for educational and promotional purposes.
guidelines.35-accordion-first-text: No entries will be accepted after the closing date.
guidelines.35-accordion-second-text: The winners will be notified via the email address provided.
guidelines.35-accordion-third-text: If there is no response within three working days, a new winner will be selected and the previous winner will forfeit their prize.
guidelines.36-accordion-first-text: The contest is void where prohibited by law.
guidelines.37-accordion-first-text: The participants retain the copyright to their contributions. Move&Act reserves the right to use, reproduce and exhibit these works in future project outputs and reports, with appropriate attribution to the author. This use is in line with the Erasmus+ objectives of sharing educational content and promoting cultural understanding.
